definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: Your shortstop will never forget about practice again.
sentences.chinese: 您的游擊手將永遠不會忘記的再實踐。

sentences.english: The real war will never get in the books.
sentences.chinese: 真正的戰爭永遠會隱沒於歷史的黑暗面。

sentences.english: Never far from her work, the mistress of the web patiently waits.
sentences.chinese: 蛛網的女主人永遠守在自己的作品邊，耐心的等候。

sentences.english: Truth? A pebble of quartz? For once, then, something.
sentences.chinese: 真相？一塊石英？只一次，便成永遠。

sentences.english: But once he learns, he'll never forget.
sentences.chinese: 但一旦他學會，就永遠忘不掉了。

sentences.english: We belonged to each other. Forever.
sentences.chinese: 我們屬於彼此，永遠屬於。

sentences.english: A dumb and a dumber will never make a good combination
sentences.chinese: 阿呆與阿瓜永遠不會是一對好組合。

sentences.english: Even weight-loss surgery doesn't always help people maintain their more svelte physiques.
sentences.chinese: 即使減肥手術也並不能讓人永遠保持苗條的體型。

sentences.english: Take me where my future's lyin', St. Elmo's Fire.
sentences.chinese: 永遠給我照亮未來，聖埃爾莫火焰。

sentences.english: You'll never get the bacon grease off the plates if you don't use detergent.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不使用去垢劑你永遠不能除去薰豬肉的油脂。

sentences.english: But you would never know that from reading the oped.
sentences.chinese: 但是僅憑閱讀評論你永遠不會知道此情況。

sentences.english: But in a sentence, it may not always mean that.
sentences.chinese: 但是在句子中，並不永遠是這樣的情況。

sentences.english: Hopes and despairs always accompany our life. But never despair of hope.
sentences.chinese: 希望和絕望總是伴隨着我們的生活，但永遠不要絕望。

sentences.english: But two wrongs can never make a right, because two wrongs can never equal each other.
sentences.chinese: 冤冤相報永無終止，因爲兩種傷害永遠不能抵消。

sentences.english: They've never been able to come to grips with the fact they're bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 他們永遠也無法面對自己是破產者的事實。

definition: always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
whatever the case/in any event/no matter what/by all possible means
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
